creator: FabianoMazza
title: Typewriter Turned Plotter
materials_required: Electronic typewriter with stepper motors (Smith Corona recommended)
Small tin can stepper with reduction gear (from an old scanner)
CNC shield with A4988 motor drivers
Slim DVD ROM drive (for Z axis)
description: This project describes how to convert a cheap, used electronic typewriter into a plotter using an Arduino and GRBL to control the stepper motors. The typewriter's existing mechanics are leveraged for X and Y axis movement, while a repurposed DVD ROM drive provides the Z axis (pen up/down) control.
steps: Choose an electronic typewriter with stepper motors for paper feed, carriage, and daisywheel movement. A Smith Corona model is recommended.
Address the carriage resolution by adding reduction gears using a small tin can stepper motor from an old scanner. Glue the pinion from the original motor to the output gear of the scanner assembly.

Configure the software and hardware: Use an Arduino UNO running standard GRBL, a CNC shield with A4988 motor drivers, a 12V power supply, and Universal G-code Sender (UGS) on a PC. Add limit switches for safety and homing.

Implement Z-axis (pen up/down) movement by disassembling a slim DVD ROM drive and using its frame, rails, and the metal piece that holds the lasers. Connect a string from the daisywheel motor to the pen carriage via a small pulley. Adjust travel limits in UGS.
